Getting Started: Registration and Workspace Access
==================================================

To use the ELSA tool, you need to register on the UN Biodiversity Lab (UNBL) platform and request access to a workspace with the ELSA tool enabled.

Registering on UNBL
-------------------

Follow these steps to create your UNBL account:

Step 1: Access the Platform
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1. Click the 'Launch map' button on the `UN Biodiversity Lab website <https://www.unbiodiversitylab.org>`_ to access the data app.

.. figure:: images/unbl-home-page.png
   :alt: UNBL home page
   :align: center
   
   UNBL home page with Launch map button highlighted

Step 2: Create Your Account
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

2. Once the platform has loaded, select the account icon in the top right-hand corner and choose 'sign up'. Enter your email, name, country, and institution (optional), and set your password to sign up.

.. figure:: images/sign-up-window.png
   :alt: Sign up window
   :align: center
   
   Account registration form

Step 3: Verify Your Email
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

3. You will receive an email within a few minutes. Follow the instructions in this email to verify your account.

Step 4: Login
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

4. Once your account is verified, you can log-in using your email address and password each time you access the platform.

Requesting Workspace Access
---------------------------

Step 5: Request ELSA Tool Access
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

5. To use the ELSA tool for your country, simply `request a workspace on UN Biodiversity Lab <#>`_ using our form and indicate that you would like access to the ELSA tool. Feel free to reach out to us at support@unbiodiversitylab.org for further questions.

Step 6: Access Your Workspace
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

6. Once the workspace has been created, you will receive email confirmation. You will be able to access it by:

   a. Navigating to the UNBL data app
   b. Toggling the workspace in the tab that appears after clicking on the 'WORKSPACES' tab in the top-left
   c. Clicking on 'ANALYSES' once you have chosen your workspace to view the ELSA tool

.. note::
   ELSA tools can be created for one or multiple countries within your workspace. Click on the arrow to expand each tool.

.. figure:: images/accessing-elsa-tool.png
   :alt: Accessing the ELSA tool
   :align: center
   
   Navigation path to access the ELSA tool in your workspace

Workspace Features
------------------

Once you have access to your workspace, you can:

* Access pre-configured ELSA tools for your country or region
* View and analyze existing analysis runs
* Create new analysis runs with customized parameters
* Download results and maps for external use
* Collaborate with team members who have access to the same workspace

.. important::
   If you encounter any issues during registration or workspace access, contact the UNBL support team at support@unbiodiversitylab.org for assistance.
